header.abstract: The James Reid letters (dated 1790 February-May; 0.05 cubic feet; 2 items) consist of two letters from James Reid to his wife Mary Reid concerning his arrival in Kentucky and his attempts at homesteading.

descriptive_summary.author: Megan Mummey
descriptive_summary.title: James Reid letters
descriptive_summary.creator: Reid, James
descriptive_summary.prefercite: 2021ms031: [identification of item], James Reid letters, 1790 February-May, University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: James Reid of New York homesteaded in Kentucky in 1790 and was married to Mary Reid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The James Reid letters (dated 1790 February-May; 0.05 cubic feet; 2 items) consist of two letters from James Reid to his wife Mary Reid concerning his arrival in Kentucky and his attempts at homesteading. His letters describe his journey to Kentucky, his lost luggage, the construction of his house, and his current business partnership.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to researchers by appointment

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The physical rights to the materials in this collection are held by the University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center.
